If you need rescue or if you are a rescuer or open shelter, tap on the map to mark your location! Texas Rescue Map aims to make it simpler for people needing rescue to coordinate with nearby rescuers and shelters. Zoom into your current location on the map and tap on it to drop a custom pin. Please include a phone number and any extra information in the description to help locate and identify you. If you need rescue: Pin your location to let volunteers know where you are and make it easier for them to find you. IE If you are a rescuer: Pin your location to let people in the area know you have a water vehicle or shelter available. Find people who have marked themselves as needing rescue.

.11 AT&T LTE 3:21 PM 95%- Sarah Marple Hubbell is at Carrabba's Italian Grill (Katy, TX). August 28 Katy.a Slightly shaken but safe now, waiting to retrieve another friend's family from their flooding neighborhood. Wrongly assumed I could get to the same pick up point as earlier, turned around but ended up between two low points on Fry Rd. Watched jeeps and trucks push through but wasn't sure about my van. A family in a truck stopped to make sure I was ok while I waited for a small lessening of torrential rain rate. Did a lot of praying and drove through safely to high ground. Now just waiting. Have been pretty tough and pragmatic and grateful for our house until standing in line at Kroger reading all the desperate calls for help and seeing even more photos of my beloved community under water. That's when the tears started. But God is good, God is faithful. #Harvey #hurricaneharvey Write a comment ...

I XFINITY Mobile 5:49 PM 86%- Q Anjali Bhangay Comment Like Share AAnjali Bhangay added 6 new photos September 15 O As we enter Week 3 of Harvey, I just want to slow down enough to acknowledge that this is difficult Our adrenaline has been pumping hard for two weeks, but now things are starting to catch up to us and to sink in. I call this "Harvey Fatigue." The emotional trauma of what has happened to our community is beginning to take its toll. Most people are back to Work and back to school, and yet thousands are dealing with the aftermath of flooded homes, Some neighborhoods look like nothing ever happened. Others look like war zones with muck-out debris filling up front yards like a massive junk yard. Some are dealing with despair. Others are dealing with survivors' guilt (which is a lie from the enemy) So proud of Houston community, family and amazing friend circle that we made through out the years. We could not have done this without your support. Thanks everyone from bottom of our heart!!

I am so, so proud to be a member of Gotta Run & RunFIT. And I am so, so proud to call the Project Manager leading this incredible effort my sister the outstanding Carrie Jackson Calkins! Ben and 59 more are on demo duty today! They're out gettin it!

HillVets: a group of outstanding US Military Veterans from Washington, D.C, who answered the call for help to serve people whom they have never met in a little town called Katy, TX during the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey. First house completed the home of Lisa McCarty, my oldest son's kind, patient and encouraging 6th grade English teacher. The interconnections of my friends, Teri Poulton, Susan Hawkins LaPrade, Joy Howerton Siebenman, Julie Jackson Millen and Stacy Vinson McCloskey brought about this chance pairing of need with help HillVets, you have seen the relieved looks of joy many times as you answer the call of duty, but some of us have never truly understood what it feels like to be rescued. It is an overwhelming emotion when you see your lifeline wading through the waters! You are an inspiration of service! Katy, TX loves you! #katystrong

Shared from Katie Nicksic, and a great summary article of the whole event. The conclusion is staggering when you think about it, and it is true! Come on down... "Houston is a miracle, and you can witness it yourself. All you have to do is hop that plane. Each person you meet here is a miracle today. They are not in graves. That is the miracle, a million times over. They are vital and thriving. They are living life the right way. They are Texans. I believe God is smiling on Texans today-he threw us a spit-ball, and we hit it out of the park."
I know exactly where I am from, and I am so proud to be a Michigander. So proud. But after what I have witnessed this last week am so proud to live here Together we are stronger. Fact.

So, the past few days have been so full. I've sent some crazy posts, desperate posts, scary posts (keep in mind my phone was hijacked few days ago so l won't take credit for ALL of those posts) I am so proud of my friends, family & community. EVERYONE is doing their part donations, food drives, demos of houses, loaning out cars, housing friends, listening to people and their stories.. & hugging people when they need it most. I wanted to share a few pics of what's happening w Natl Guard.. they are helping get those still in the mandatory evac areas to homes/apts to get any left pets (fish, birds, etc) or medicines. I am grateful that each day we get a couple more trucks and we're figuring how to get a little more organized lease keep in mind that this whole rebuild process will be a marathon event. A lot of us may go back to work or school after another week or so, but we will have friends who will need our help for much longer than that. Scott and I will be back at our post in the morning as we've grown quite fond of our fellow volunteers and want to complete this current mission. But for now, it's time for an adult beverage and hot shower Peace y'al

Please Share!! (It's important that you "Share" my post and not copy and paste. When you "Share" the post, everyone will get the updates that I make immediately Even if you have read this post once, there may be updates that I add to it throughout the day. Thank you for getting out the word on this ever-changing situation.) Update as of 8:00am Sunday: The Barker Reservoir is at 99.17. We will need to reach below 97' before we see all of our homes and businesses free of internal water We need to reach below 95' before we see all water recede off our streets and back into the reservoir Sewer Plant is still not operating!! Cinco MUD 5, 6, 7 and 8 Affected New info: Per Mike Price, MUD Board 7 Bayou Oaks and Hunters Glen in MUD 7 are not part of the affected area These two neighborhoods are serviced by a functioning sewer plant. Please use bathroom, kitchen, and utility as normal Critical: For those who are going into the standing water: The levels of toxicity are EXTREMELY high. We have rotting corpses of animals and fecal matter floating in still waters. Please use good judgment. We do not want our community to suffer further harm nor do we want to further overwhelm our hospitals with cases of life-threatening bacteria infections."

Update: As of 4:00pm today, the PSA from the National Guard confirmed the presence of ecoli in the water, those concentration levels will continue to rise "New Update as of 11:30am from National Guard Command Post at Mason Road 1. Manhole covers have been blown off, and the holes are exposed under water. Since you cannot see them as you wade through the water, the danger is that you will step into the hole and be drug underneath into the sewer pipe. This is absolutely a life-threatening hazard!! We have already lost a life in Old Town Katy due to this issue. Please do not walk through the standing water. High trucks are available at the command post at Mason to escort you to your home 2. The Army Corps of Engineers will be assessing our bridges that were compromised during the flood. No bridge in our area has been inspected as of today, Sunday, September 3rd. We cannot guarantee your safety if you choose to walk across the bridges that are still in the mandatory evacuation zone. Please take every precaution. 3. It is NOT recommended to access property in mandatory evacuation zones, but, if you choose to access your home, please use kayaks ONLY Boats are now getting damaged by fire hydrants, low water areas, and other debris "Update per Julie Millen: As of 4:00pm The National Guard has removed the Command Center at Mason Road Best Trash Link to Current Info: http://www.best-trash.com/ Texas Pride Disposal Link to Current Info: http://www.texaspridedisposal.com/

Tomorrow the Mason Road Command Post will open again at 10:00 am. The absolutely INCREDIBLE Army National Guard will be there to get people in and out of their houses safely. I'll be running Truck #101 again, and will be leading the way! I have the best crew there ever could be, and it is such an honor to work by their sides. It might be the weekend, but We will be going until we run out of daylight again tomorrow, because that's how the "Mighty Eagle" rolls!

PSA for those who have been in the flood waters... I got bitten by something (probably some fire ants), and noticed swelling and redness. Normally I would have treated it at home but given I spent a number of hours in toxic flood waters (as SOOo many did) so I went to have it looked at. I'm glad I did! They gave me a shot, antibiotics and cream. It definitely was infected, and would have definitely escalated quickly if left untreated. The Doctor did urge anyone who has been in the water to watch yourself very carefully for the next few days. The toxicity Sunday and Monday was less intense than as time went on (hence the beautiful brown color). Sharing for those who would normally tough it out. Just go get checked out! Thanks to the power from Witte Blue to make sure I got this looked at as well! Given their recent experiences, they did not take this lightly, and neither did I

We will flood, and will likely loose most of what we have, which could care less about. I know it's a tall order but I just want us and all of our friends to get out safely Not sure where we are headed yet but can't pick a destination until the morning, depending on the conditions. Evacuating is extremely, extremely dangerous, I know that sounds easy (it was Thursday), but it is not now. Roads are flooded everywhere There are so many already so badly affected. We have the means to do whatever we need and we have another home we can go to if needed. So many do not. We are so fortunate and so many are not. Thank you all so much for all the love and concern. Our staff is five people strong. In response to the damage caused by Hurricane Harvey, each one of us has been on a mission to channel our energy where it's needed most - in our neighborhoods, side-by-side with you to address the immediate needs of safety and security for all. This is our priority, even as we continue to build towards a new store opening date. Our hearts are with you and yours. Our hands will continue to help in any way we can There is no doubt the toll this event has and will continue to have on our mental, physical and emotional health. AT&T LTE 10:00 PM 37% Andrea McDonald Witte Julie Jackson Millen is with Andrea McDonald Witte and Scott Witte. August 31, 2017 Cinco Ranch . PSA for those who have been in the flood waters.. I got bitten by something (probably some fire ants), and noticed swelling and redness. Normally I would have treated it at home but given I spent a number of hours in toxic flood waters (as SOOO many did), so l went to have it looked at. I'm glad I did! They gave me a shot, antibiotics and cream. It definitely was infected, and would have definitely escalated quickly if left untreated The Doctor did urge anyone who has been in the water to watch yourself very carefully for the next few days. The toxicity Sunday and Monday was less intense than as time went on (hence the beautiful brown color). Sharing for those who would normally tough it out. Just go get checked out! Thanks to the power from Witte Blue to make sure l got this looked at as well! Given their recent experiences, they did not take this lightly, and neither did Just another example of all of this taking the best Village ever! 2
